places_to_visit.name: The Great Wall of China
places_to_visit.description: The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications made of various materials, including earth, wood, and stone, built to protect Chinese states and empires from invasions. It stretches over 13,000 miles and includes several sections such as Badaling and Mutianyu.

places_to_visit.name: Beijing
places_to_visit.description: Beijing, the capital of China, is home to several historical landmarks such as the Forbidden City, the Temple of Heaven, and Tiananmen Square. The city serves as a gateway to various sections of the Great Wall.

places_to_visit.name: Jinshanling Great Wall
places_to_visit.description: Jinshanling is one of the best-preserved sections of the Great Wall, known for its picturesque landscapes and relatively untouched state. It provides a less crowded experience compared to more popular sections.
